settings.name: Settings
settings.descr: The following describes the available settings of the simulator.

main.name: Settings
main.descr: The global settings of the simulator specify, among other things, the language, the symbol form to be used or the paths of external tools.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Use IEEE 91-1984 shapes instead of rectangular shapes
Language of the GUI. Will only take effect after a restart.
Screen format of expressions.
Color scheme
User Defined Colors

attr.name: Component tree view is visible at startup.

attributes.attr: If set, the component tree view is enabled at startup.
Shows a grid in the main window.

attr.name: Show the number of wires on a bus.

attributes.attr: CAUTION: The value is only updated when the simulation starts.

attr.name: No tool tips for components on the main panel.

attributes.attr: If set, no tool tips for the components on the main panel are displayed. Especially in a presentation, these tool tips can be very annoying.
If set, lines are highlighted when the mouse hovers over them.

Folder which contains the library with predefined sub circuits. Contains, for example, the components of the 74xx series. You also can add your own circuits by storing them at this location. It must be ensured that the names of all files in this folder and all subfolders are unique.
A jar file containing additional components implemented in Java.
Path to the fitter for the ATF15xx. Enter the directory which contains the fit15xx.exe files provided by Microchip (former ATMEL).
Path to the executable file ATMISP.exe. If set, the ATMISP software can be started automatically!
Path to the executable ghdl file. Only necessary if you want to use ghdl to simulate components defined with VHDL.
Path to the Icarus Verilog installation folder. Only necessary if you want to use iverilog to simulate components defined with Verilog.
Used to configurate an integration of a toolchain. Allows the start of external tools, e.g. to program an FPGA or similar.
Size of the fonts used in the menu in percent of the default size.
Uses CTRL-click instead of right-click.

Use the equal key instead of the plus key. This is always useful if the plus character is not a primary key, but the second assignment of the equals character, e.g. for an American or French keyboard layout.

attr.name: Show dialog for automatic renaming of tunnels.

attributes.attr: If set, a dialog for automatically renaming all tunnels of the same name is displayed after a tunnel has been renamed.

circuit.name: Circuit specific settings
circuit.descr: The circuit specific settings affect the behavior of the currently open circuit. For example, the shape that represents the circuit when it is embedded in other circuits. These settings are stored together with the circuit.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
Width of symbol if this circuit is used as an component in an other circuit.
Background color of the circuit when it is embedded in another circuit. Is not used for DIL packages.
A short description of this element and its usage.
Number of gate propagation times at which a oscillation is detected if the circuit has not stabilized by then.
The circuit is locked. It is possible to configure diodes and FGF-FETs.

The shape to be used for the representation of the circuit in an embedding circuit. In the "Simple" mode, the inputs are displayed on the left and the outputs on the right side of a simple rectangle. With "Layout", the position of the inputs and outputs and their orientation in the circuit determines the position of the pins. Here it is possible to have pins at the top or the bottom. When selecting "DIL-Chip", a DIL housing is used to display the circuit. The pin numbers of the inputs and outputs determine the position of the pins in this case.
Import of a SVG file
Height of symbol if this circuit is used as an component in an other circuit.
Number of pins. A zero means that the number of pins is determined automatically.
Content of all used ROMs

attr.name: Show measurement values at simulation start

attributes.attr: When the simulation is started, a table with the measured values is shown.

attr.name: Show measurement graph at simulation start

attributes.attr: When the simulation is started, a graph with the measured values is shown.

attr.name: Show measurement graph in single gate step mode at simulation start

attributes.attr: When the simulation is started, a graph with the measured values in the gate step mode is shown. All gate changes are included in the graph.

attr.name: Max number of steps to show

attributes.attr: The maximal number of values stored. If the maximum number is reached, the oldest values are discarded.

When simulating a processor that uses a RAM device as the program memory, it is difficult to start this processor because the RAM contents are always initialized with zeros at the start of the simulation. This setting allows loading data into the program memory at startup. The program memory in the simulation must be marked as such.
File which should be loaded into the program memory at the start of the simulation.
Use big endian byte order at import.
Skips generating the internals of the circuit in Verilog/VHDL export. The references to the circuit are kept, making it possible to override the implementation.
Allows to create a generic circuit.

cli.heading: Command Line Interface
cli.indent:
java -cp Digital.jar CLI test -circ [String] [-tests [String]] [-allowMissingInputs] [-verbose]: The first file name specifies the circuit to be tested. If a second file name is specified, the test cases are executed from this file. If no second file name is specified, the tests are executed from the first file.
Options: -circ [String(def: )] Name of the file to be tested.
[-tests [String(def: )]] Name of a file with test cases.
[-allowMissingInputs(def: false)] Allows the lack of inputs in the circuit which are defined in the test case. This can be useful if there are several possible solutions which may depend on different inputs.
[-verbose(def: false)] If set, the value table is output in case of an error.
svg -dig [String] [-svg [String]] [-ieee] [-LaTeX] [-pinsInMathMode] [-hideTest] [-noShapeFilling] [-smallIO] [-noPinMarker] [-thinnerLines] [-highContrast] [-monochrome]: Can be used to create an SVG file from a circuit.
Options: -dig [String(def: )] The file name of the circuit.
[-svg [String(def: )]] The name of the SVG file to be written.
[-ieee(def: false)] Use the IEEE symbols.
[-LaTeX(def: false)] Text is inserted in LaTeX notation. Inkscape is required for further processing.
[-pinsInMathMode(def: false)] For pin labels, use math mode even if no indexes are contained.
[-hideTest(def: false)] Hide Test Cases
[-noShapeFilling(def: false)] Polygons are not filled.
[-smallIO(def: false)] Inputs and outputs are represented as small circles.
[-noPinMarker(def: false)] The blue and red pin markers on the symbols are omitted.
[-thinnerLines(def: false)] If set, the lines are drawn slightly thinner.
[-highContrast(def: false)] The wires and the text of the pins are displayed in black.
[-monochrome(def: false)] Only gray colors are used.
stats -dig [String] [-csv [String]]: Creates a CSV file which contains the circuit statistics. All components used are listed in the CSV file.
Options: -dig [String(def: )] File name of the circuit.
[-csv [String(def: )]] Name of the CSV file to be created. If this option is missing, the table is written to stdout.

element.name: And
element.descr: Binary AND gate. Returns high only if all inputs are also set high. It is also possible to use buses with several bits as inputs and output. In this case, a bitwise AND is executed. This means that the lowest bits of all inputs are connected with AND and is output as the lowest bit at the output. The same happens with bit 1, bit 2 and so on. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The 1. input value for the logic operation.
The 2. input value for the logic operation.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Returns the result of the logic operation.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The Number of Inputs used. Every input needs to be connected.
You can select the inputs that are to be inverted.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Uses a wider shape to visualize the gate.

element.name: NAnd
element.descr: A combination of AND and NOT. Returns 0 only if all inputs are set to 1. If one of the inputs is set to 0 the output is set to 1. It is also possible to use buses with several bits per input. In this case, the operation is applied to each bit of the inputs. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The 1. input value for the logic operation.
The 2. input value for the logic operation.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Returns the result of the logic operation.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The Number of Inputs used. Every input needs to be connected.
You can select the inputs that are to be inverted.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Uses a wider shape to visualize the gate.

element.name: Or
element.descr: Binary OR gate. Returns a 1 if one of the inputs is set to 1. If all inputs are set to 0 the output is also set to 0. It is also possible to use buses with several bits as inputs and output. In this case, a bitwise OR is executed. This means that the lowest bits of all inputs are connected with OR and is output as the lowest bit at the output. The same happens with bit 1, bit 2 and so on. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The 1. input value for the logic operation.
The 2. input value for the logic operation.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Returns the result of the logic operation.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The Number of Inputs used. Every input needs to be connected.
You can select the inputs that are to be inverted.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Uses a wider shape to visualize the gate.

element.name: NOr
element.descr: A combination of OR and NOT. Returns a 0 if one of the inputs is set to 1. If all inputs are set to 0 the output is also set to 1. It is also possible to use buses with several bits per input. In this case, the operation is applied to each bit of the inputs. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The 1. input value for the logic operation.
The 2. input value for the logic operation.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Returns the result of the logic operation.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The Number of Inputs used. Every input needs to be connected.
You can select the inputs that are to be inverted.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Uses a wider shape to visualize the gate.

element.name: XOr
element.descr: If two inputs are used, the output is 0 if both input bits are equal. Otherwise the output in set to 1. If more than two inputs are used, it behaves like cascaded XOR gates ( A XOR B XOR C = (A XOR B) XOR C ). It is also possible to use buses with several bits per input. In this case, the operation is applied to each bit of the inputs. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The 1. input value for the logic operation.
The 2. input value for the logic operation.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Returns the result of the logic operation.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The Number of Inputs used. Every input needs to be connected.
You can select the inputs that are to be inverted.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Uses a wider shape to visualize the gate.

element.name: XNOr
element.descr: A combination of XOR and NOT. The inputs are combined with the XOR operation. The result of this operation is then inverted. It is also possible to use buses with several bits per input. In this case, the operation is applied to each bit of the inputs. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The 1. input value for the logic operation.
The 2. input value for the logic operation.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Returns the result of the logic operation.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The Number of Inputs used. Every input needs to be connected.
You can select the inputs that are to be inverted.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Uses a wider shape to visualize the gate.

element.name: Not
element.descr: Inverts the input value. A 1 becomes a 0 and a 0 becomes 1. It is also possible to use a bus with several bits per input. In this case, the operation is applied to each bit of the inputs. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The input of the NOT gate.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Uses a wider shape to visualize the gate.

element.name: Lookup Table
element.descr: Gets the output value from a stored table. So this gate can emulate every combinatorial gate. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: Input 0. This input in combination with all other inputs defines the address of the stored value to be returned.
Input 1. This input in combination with all other inputs defines the address of the stored value to be returned.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Returns the stored value at the address set via the inputs.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The Number of Inputs used. Every input needs to be connected.
The name of this element.
The values stored in this element.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

element.name: Output
element.descr: Can be used to display an output signal in a circuit. This element is also used to connect a circuit to an embedding circuit. In this case the connection is bidirectional. Is also used to assign a pin number, if the code for a CPLD or FPGA is generated. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: This value is used for the output connection.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The name of this element.
A short description of this element and its usage.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
The format used to show the numbers.
Number of fractional binary digits

Number of this pin. Used for the representation of a circuit as a DIL package and the pin assignment when programming a CPLD. If there are several bits, all pin numbers can be specified as a comma-separated list.
Shows the value in the measurement graph.
If selected, a smaller shape will be used.

element.name: LED
element.descr: A LED can be used to visualize an output value. Accepts a single bit. Lights up if the input is set to 1.

element.name: Input
element.descr: Can be used to interactively manipulate an input signal in a circuit with the mouse. This element is also used to connect a circuit to an embedding circuit. In this case the connection is bidirectional. Is also used to assign an pin number, if code for a CPLD or FPGA is generated. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Gives the value which is connected to this input.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.
The name of this element.
A short description of this element and its usage.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
This value is set if the circuit is started. A "Z" means high-z state.
If set the input is allowed to be in high-z state. At the input component this is also allowed if high-z ("Z") is set as the default value.
Avoids zero output. This is especially helpful when setting up relay circuits. Can only be activated if a high-z output is allowed.
The format used to show the numbers.
Number of fractional binary digits

Number of this pin. Used for the representation of a circuit as a DIL package and the pin assignment when programming a CPLD. If there are several bits, all pin numbers can be specified as a comma-separated list.
Shows the value in the measurement graph.
If selected, a smaller shape will be used.

element.name: Clock Input
element.descr: A clock signal. It's possible to control it by a real-time clock. Depending on the complexity of the circuit, the clock frequency achieved may be less than the selected value. If the frequency is greater than 50Hz, the graphic representation of the circuit will no longer be updated at every clock cycle so that the wire colors will no longer be updated. If the real-time clock is not activated, the clock can be controlled by mouse clicks. Is also used to assign an pin number, if code for a CPLD or FPGA is generated. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: Switches between 0 and 1 with the selected clock frequency.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
If enabled the runtime clock is started when the circuit is started
The real time frequency used for the real time clock
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

Number of this pin. Used for the representation of a circuit as a DIL package and the pin assignment when programming a CPLD. If there are several bits, all pin numbers can be specified as a comma-separated list.
If selected, a smaller shape will be used.

element.name: Button
element.descr: A simple push button which goes back to its original state when it is released.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: The output signal of the button.

attributes.name: Attributes

If selected the output is low if the component is active.
Button is mapped to the keyboard. To use the cursor keys use UP, DOWN, LEFT or RIGHT as label.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Shows the value in the measurement graph.

element.descr: Simple DIP switch that can output either high or low.

element.name: Probe
element.descr: A measurement value which can be shown in the data graph or measurement table. This component can be used to easily observe values from embedded circuits. Does not affect the simulation.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The measurement value.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
Defines whether the value or a counter is to be displayed.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
The format used to show the numbers.
Number of fractional binary digits
Shows the value in the measurement graph.

element.name: Data Graph
element.descr: Shows a data plot inside of the circuit panel. You can plot complete clock cycles or single gate changes. Does not affect the simulation.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Shows all single step steps in the graphic.

attr.name: Max number of steps to show

attributes.attr: The maximal number of values stored. If the maximum number is reached, the oldest values are discarded.
If set, the component is aligned with the grid.

element.name: Triggered Data Graph
element.descr: Shows a graph of measured values, whereby measured values are only stored if the input signal changes. Storing takes place when the circuit has stabilized. The trigger does not start the measurement like in a real scope, but each trigger event stores a single measurement value for each of the shown signals. As direct input there is only the trigger. The inputs and outputs of the circuit, flip-flops and registers and the probe component can be used as signals. This can be activated in the respective components.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: A change at this input causes measured values to be stored.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
Trigger condition for data recording.

attr.name: Max number of steps to show

attributes.attr: The maximal number of values stored. If the maximum number is reached, the oldest values are discarded.

element.descr: An RGB LED whose color can be controlled via three inputs. At each of the three inputs, a color channel is connected.

element.name: LED with two connections.
element.descr: LED with connections for the cathode and the anode. The LED lights up if the anode is connected to high and the cathode is connected to low. This LED cannot be used as a pull-down resistor. It acts solely as a display element. The shown resistor is only meant to symbolize the required series resistor to limit the current.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The anode connection of the LED.
The cathode connection of the LED.

This input controls the lower, right, vertical line.

This input controls the lower, left, vertical line.

This input controls the middle, horizontal line.
This input controls the decimal point.

Kind of common connection.
Specifies the duration of the afterglow. The larger the value, the longer the afterglow duration.

element.name: 16-Segment Display

element.name: Light Bulb
element.descr: Light bulb with two connections. If a current flows, the bulb lights up! The direction of the current does not matter. The lamp lights when the inputs have different values. The bulb behaves similar to an XOr gate.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: Connection
Connection

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
The Color of the element.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

element.name: LED-Matrix
element.descr: A matrix of LEDs. The LEDs are shown in a separate window. The LEDs of a column of the display are controlled by a data word. At another input, the current column is selected. So a multiplexed display is realized. The LEDs are able to light up indefinitely in the simulation to prevent the display from flickering.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The row state of the LEDs of a column. Each bit in this data word represents the state of a row of the current column.
The number of the current column whose state is currently visible at the other input.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
Specifies the number of rows by specifying the number of bits of the row word.
Addresses the individual columns. Three bits means eight columns.
The Color of the element.

It is not possible to increase the frequency so much that the flickering disappears. In order to suppress the flickering nevertheless, a "afterglow" can be switched on for the LEDs with this option. If enabled, the LEDs remain on, even if one of the pins changes to high-z. This simulates a frequency above the critical flicker fusion frequency.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

element.name: Rotary Encoder
element.descr: Rotary knob with rotary encoder. Used to detect rotational movements.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

element.name: Keyboard
element.descr: A keyboard that can be used to enter text. This component buffers the input, which can then be read out. A separate window is opened for the text input.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: Clock. A rising edge removes the oldest character from the buffer.
If high, the output D is active and one character is output. It also enables the clock input.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: The last typed character, or zero if no character is available. Output is the 16 bit Java char value.
This output indicates that characters are available. It can be used to trigger an interrupt.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
You can select the inputs that are to be inverted.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

Clock. A rising edge writes the value at the input to the terminal window.
A high at this input enables the clock input.

element.name: Tunnel
element.descr: Connects components without a wire. All tunnel elements, which have the same net name, are connected together. Works only locally, so it is not possible to connect different circuits. Unnamed tunnels are ignored silently. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

element.name: Splitter/Merger
element.descr: Splits or creates a wire bundle or a data bus with more than one bit. With a bus it is e.g. possible to generate 16-bit connections without having to route 16 individual wires. All 16 connections can be merged into one wire. The splitter has a direction, meaning it can only transmit signals in one direction. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: The input bits 0-3.
The input bits 4-7.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: If e.g. four bits, two bits and two further bits are to be used as inputs, this can be configured with "4,2,2". The number indicates the number of bits. For convenience, the asterisk can be used: 16 bits can be configured with "[Bits]*[Number]" as "1*16". It is also possible to specify the bits to be used directly and in any order. For example, "4-7,0-3" configures bits 4-7 and 0-3. This notation allows any bit arrangement. The input bits must be specified completely and unambiguously.

If e.g. four bits, two bits and two further bits are to be used as outputs, this can be configured with "4,2,2". The number indicates the number of bits. For convenience, the asterisk can be used: 16 bits can be configured with "[Bits]*[Number]" as "1*16". It is also possible to specify the bits to be used directly and in any order. For example, "4-7,0-3" configures bits 4-7 and 0-3. This notation allows any bit arrangement. Output bits can also be output several times: "0-7,1-6,4-7".
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Mirrors the component in the circuit.
Configures the spread of the inputs and outputs in the circuit.

element.name: Graphic RAM
element.descr: Used to show a bitmap graphic. This element behaves like a RAM. In addition it shows its content on a graphic screen. Every pixel is represented by a memory address. The value stored defines the color of the pixel, using a fixed color palette. There are two screen buffers implemented to support page flipping. The input B selects which buffer is shown. Thus, the total memory size is dx * dy * 2 words. The palette used is structured as follows: The indices 0-9 correspond to the colors white, black, red, green, blue, yellow, cyan, magenta, orange and pink. The indices 32-63 map gray values and the indices 64-127 represent 64 color values each with two bits per color channel. This results in a simple palette that can be addressed with only 7-bit. If the architecture supports a 16-bit index, from Index 0x8000, a high-color mode with 5 bits per color channel can be used, which enables 32768 colors.

element.name: P-Channel FET
element.descr: P-Channel Field Effect Transistor. The bulk is connected to the pos. voltage rail and the transistor is simulated without a body diode.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: Gate

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: Number of data bits used.

Unidirectional transistors propagate a signal only from source to drain. They are much faster to simulate than bidirectional transistors. Since there is no feedback from drain to source, in this mode, the transistor can not short the connected wires when it is conducting. Thus, this mode is necessary to simulate certain CMOS circuits.
The name of this element.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.
Mirrors the component in the circuit.

element.name: Diode to VDD
element.descr: A simplified unidirectional diode, used to pull a wire to VDD. It is used to implement a wired OR. So it is necessary to connect a pull down resistor to the diodes output. In the simulation the diode behaves like an active gate with a trivalent truth table: If the input high, the output is also high. In all other cases (input is low or high z) the output is in high z state. So two anti parallel connected diodes can keep each other in high state, which is not possible with real diodes. This is an ideal diode: There is no voltage drop across a forward-biased diode.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: If the input is high also the output is high. In all other cases the output is in high z state.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: If the input is high also the output is high. In all other cases the output is in high z state.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: If set a diode is "blown" or "programmed". At a floating gate FET the floating gate is charged. You can change this setting with the [P] key.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

element.name: Diode to Ground
element.descr: A simplified unidirectional diode, used to pull a wire to ground. It is used to implement a wired AND. So it is necessary to connect a pull up resistor to the diodes output. If the input low, the output is also low. In the other cases (input is high or high z) the output is in high z state. So two anti parallel connected diodes can keep each other in low state, which is not possible with real diodes. So this is a ideal diode: There is no voltage drop across a forward-biased diode.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: If the input is low also the output is low. In all other cases the output is in high z state.

outputs.name: Outputs
outputs.pin: If the input is low also the output is low. In all other cases the output is in high z state.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: If set a diode is "blown" or "programmed". At a floating gate FET the floating gate is charged. You can change this setting with the [P] key.
The orientation of the Element in the circuit.

element.descr: P-Channel Floating Gate Field Effect Transistor. The bulk is connected to ground and the transistor is simulated without a body diode. If there is a charge stored in the floating gate, the fet isn't conducting even if the gate is low.

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: Gate

element.name: Test case
element.descr: Describes a test case. In a test case you can describe how a circuit should behave. It can then be automatically checked whether the behavior of the circuit actually corresponds to this description. If this is not the case, an error message is shown. The help text of the test case editor describes in detail how such a test case can be created. Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

element.name: External
element.descr: Component to execute an external process to calculate the logic function. Is used to specify the behaviour of a component by VHDL or Verilog. The actual simulation of the behavior must be done with an external simulator. At present only the VHDL simulator ghdl and the verilog simulator Icarus Verilog are supported. The label of the component must match the name of the entity or module! Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

attributes.name: Attributes
attributes.attr: The name of this element.
Width of symbol if this circuit is used as an component in an other circuit.

The inputs of the external process. It is a comma-separated list of signal names. For each signal name, a number of bits separated by a colon can be specified. The inputs of an 8-bit adder could thus be described as "a:8,b:8,c_in".

The outputs of the external process. It is a comma-separated list of signal names. For each signal name, a number of bits separated by a colon can be specified. The outputs of an 8-bit adder could thus be described as "s:8,c_out".
The program code to be executed by the external application.
Defines which application to use.
Options that are used for all processing steps by GHDL.
Options that are used for all processing steps by IVerilog.

element.name: External File
element.descr: Component to execute an external process to calculate the logic function. Is used to specify the behaviour of a component by VHDL or Verilog. The actual simulation of the behavior must be done with an external simulator. At present only the VHDL simulator ghdl and the verilog simulator Icarus Verilog are supported. The label of the component must match the name of the entity or module! Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

attributes.name: Attributes

The outputs of the external process. It is a comma-separated list of signal names. For each signal name, a number of bits separated by a colon can be specified. The outputs of an 8-bit adder could thus be described as "s:8,c_out".
The file containing the program code to be executed by the external application.
Defines which application to use.
Options that are used for all processing steps by GHDL.

element.descr: Control logic for a bidirectional pin. This component is necessary only in the context of VHDL or Verilog generation, in order to create a bidirectional HDL port! If you don't want to use a bidirectional IO-port on an FPGA, don't use this component! The PinControl component cannot be used in an embedded circuit! It is only allowed at the top level circuit! Exportable to VHDL/Verilog.

element.name: Break
element.descr: If this component is used in the circuit, the "Run To Break" button between "Start" and "Stop" is enabled. This button clocks the circuit until a rising edge on the input of this component is detected. This element can be used for debugging by clocking the circuit to any breakpoint. Also an assembler command BRK can be implemented. This allows to execute a program up to the next BRK command. This function can only be used if the real-time clock is deactivated!

inputs.name: Inputs
inputs.pin: Stops the fast simulation clocking if a rising edge is detected.

element.name: Asynchronous Timing
element.descr: Allows configuration of the timing of an asynchronous sequential circuit such as a Muller-pipeline. The circuit must be started in single gate step mode and must be able to reach a stable state at startup. The sequential circuit can then be started interactively or with a reset gate. It is not allowed to use a regular clock component in this mode.

attributes.attr: If enabled the runtime clock is started when the circuit is started
The real time frequency used for the real time clock
